subject: Re: [junit] testCreate, testUpdate, testDelete: make one  single test out of it?
msgSnippet: ... The only way to learn this lesson is to let yourself get into trouble doing it the easy way. If that day never comes, then don t worry about; otherwise,
messageBody:
>So said Tung Wai Yip on 4/16/2003 --------------------
>I wrote a testCreate to create and verify a record.
>
>Then testUpdate to update and verify the record created in testCreate.
>
>Finally the testDelete to test delete the record created in testCreate.
>
>The thress test cases comprise of a suite of test for the persistence of
>one
>kind of record. This contradicts with the idea that each test case should
>be
>independent. On the other hand the test cases are easy to write and I'm
>happy
>with the result. I wonder if there is any convincing reason to write a
>complex
>test case just so it can be totally independently from the others.

The only way to learn this lesson is to let yourself get into trouble doing it the "easy" way. If that day never comes, then don't worry about; otherwise, you'll see the problems when you hit them.

What you're doing is fine testing, but it's not Programmer Testing, so don't treat it that way. Separate those tests into another suite and don't run them as frequently as you run the Programmer Tests.

Take care.
